Based on your preference for classic films, I'd highly recommend "Ella Enchanted" (2004). This charming fairy tale follows Ella, who is under a spell of obedience and her journey to break free. Starring Anne Hathaway, it's a delightful watch!

Another classic you might enjoy is "Things Fall Apart" (1958), a thought-provoking drama that explores the consequences of an unusual artifact at a dinner party. Directed by Joseph Strick and starring Hansford Rowe, it's a film that will keep you intrigued!

I'd highly recommend "13 Going on 30" for a surprising and emotional comedy. This movie follows an unpopular teenager who wakes up as a 30-year-old woman, starring Jennifer Garner in a heartwarming performance. It's a delightful blend of humor, nostalgia, and self-discovery that I believe you might enjoy!

If you're looking for something with a unique twist, "Jennifer's Body" might be up your alley too. It's about a high school cheerleader who turns into a succubus, leading to a thrilling tale of horror and friendship. Enjoy the ride!
